paper_abstract: Let lambda = {lambda(k)} k is an element of Z be a bounded sequence of positive real numbers holding the property Sigma(k is an element of Z)(k not equal 0) vertical bar log lambda k/k vertical bar < infinity and sigma(lambda)(t) : = Pi(k is an element of Z) lambda(sinc(t-k))(k). The objective of this paper is to prove that sigma(lambda) is an analytic function and for every t is an element of R, sigma(lambda) (t) = lim(n ->infinity) (Sigma(k is an element of Z) lambda(1/n)(k) sinc(t-k))(n). This result can be consider as the general sufficient condition type theorem which generalizes the Shannon Whittaker Kotel'nikov's recomposition Theorem for the "exponential-trigonometric type maps" which have been long time looked for applications in the chemistry world. As a consequence we obtain, as a corollary, the results from [4] which were obtained by direct approach. Important applications to the signal theory are derived too since many signals can be written in sigma(lambda) format for a proper sequence lambda.
